job_title: Testing Proctor in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Great staff/faculty/students. Competive wage, great benefits. NIC promotes advancement.
cons: I do not have any cons.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: The students at NIC are a great group of all ages.
cons: The pay for adjunct faculty isn't great but the work environment is good.

job_title: Supervisor in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: So many great people who love what they do and really care about the students. Really good benefits.
cons: Have to pay for parking.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Helping students meet their goals.
cons: The college governing board is dysfunctional to the point of threatening accreditation status. Severe morale issues among staff and faculty.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Excellent team atmosphere. Great benefits.

job_title: Teacher in Kellogg, ID
pros: Summers off! Kids are the highlight!

review_title: Opportunity Filled Workplace in North Idaho
job_title: Marketing & Events Coordinator in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros:
Lots of engagement opportunities, lunch and learn, etc.
Free Employee Wellness Classes at Wellness Center
Cheap on campus SWRC (gym) memberships available
Beautiful lakeside campus/workplace
Opportunity to join NIC work committees according to interest
Tuition waiver opportunities for immediate family 
GREAT benefits
Chance to make a difference!
cons:
Hiring process can be slow 
Often meaningful change takes long while
Culture can be frustrating and inefficient, processes disjointed

job_title: Adult Education Instructor in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: The Positives - classroom autonomy, supportive co-workers and administration, student-focused decision-making.
cons: The Negatives - low to moderate pay, part-time positions that do not include benefits or paid leave.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Nice staff, casual environment, flexible hours

job_title: Class Room Assistant in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Great people wonderful work environment.

job_title: Customer Service Manager in Coeur d'Alene, ID

job_title: Coordinator in Coeur d'Alene, ID

review_title: Great students, faculty, staff, but administration is centralized and very authoritarian
job_title: Unspecified in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Beautiful setting on lake Coeur dAlene, lovely campus. Most faculty are very student-centered, staff is generally very friendly.
cons: Current administration is corporate-minded rather than student centered. Only "yes-men" are advanced in the current setting, and the actual students we historically have served for the more than 30 years I have been associated with this college are not the main motivating force anymore. The push is now to improve student completion rates (to enhance federal funding) by invoking policies designed to push out the lower-achieving students, so that they are not bringing the completion rates down anymore.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Beautiful campus! There are some really good people working there.
cons: Leadership is a mess. They cannot be trusted and have made some highly questionable moves in the past few years. The reputation of the college and leadership have declined dramatically since the current President started. There are other members of his cabinet that are poor leaders. HR at the college does not serve the employees at the level they should. They do not provide timely responses. You also have to be careful what you say to them but it tends to get out. Some of the employees will stab you in the back. Others are just trying to survive and don't want to lose their jobs so they lay low. The environment with the approval process is archaic and inefficient. It takes way too long to get important things done.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: As adjunct faculty I enjoy the leadership given by the department heads.  Online course building instructing is well put together.  You couldn't ask for a prettier campus.
cons: When you are teaching online there is very little intreaction with other staff unless you reach out for it.  Otherwise everything is great

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Amazing people and community to work with! My position was very flexible in terms of scheduling work hours and the people I report to are great.
cons: As with a lot of educational institutions it can be difficult to get things moving/approved at a fast pace and there is not as much potential for advancement as there would be in the private sector.

review_title: Fulfilling, intimate workplace. Many opportunities to make a difference.
job_title: Tutor in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Small size college, beautiful location right by a lake, relaxed work atmosphere, the students and staff seem to genuinely enjoy being a part of the NIC family.
cons: Some positions may require advanced degrees or training. Job opportunities may be rare or only part time.

review_title: Great place to work in the CDA area
